quotes.quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his own experience.
quotes.author: Locke

quotes.quote: All things truly wicked start from an innocence.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Three may keep a secret if two of them are dead.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote:
There are two kinds of men: the righteous who think they are sinners 
and the sinners who think they are righteous.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: The greatest virtue in human matter is always patience.
quotes.author: Dionysius Cato

quotes.quote: Woman is always fickle--foolish is he who trusts her.
quotes.author: Francis I

quotes.quote: Those who can bear all can dare all.
quotes.author: Marquis de Vauvenargues

quotes.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Fear is a feeling that is stronger than love.
quotes.author: Pliny the Younger

quotes.quote: We walk alone in the world. Friends such as we desire, are dreams and fables.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
